name: Wise Elder
description: An old guide who helps new travelers

name.name: Wise Elder
name.description: A weathered traveler who has seen much of the world

nodes.speaker: Wise Elder
nodes.text: Welcome, traveler! I am the Wise Elder, keeper of this waypoint. You find yourself at the center of the world. Would you like me to teach you the ways of survival?

nodes.speaker: Wise Elder
nodes.text: Very well! First, movement. Use the arrow keys or ZQSD to walk. Bump into enemies to attack them. The world is vast - explore in any direction you wish.

nodes.speaker: Wise Elder
nodes.text: Combat is simple but deadly. Walk into an enemy to strike them. Watch your HP in the status bar - if it reaches zero, you perish. Press [I] to open your inventory and use healing items.

nodes.speaker: Wise Elder
nodes.text: Defeating enemies grants experience. Gain enough and you will level up, becoming stronger. You can also find better weapons and armor in dungeons and shops. Look for the '>' symbol - it marks dungeon entrances!

nodes.speaker: Wise Elder
nodes.text: Press [I] for your inventory. You can [E]quip weapons and armor, [U]se consumables like potions, or [T]hrow items at enemies. Potions can heal you, boost your stats, or even have... stranger effects. Merchants in villages will trade with you.

nodes.speaker: Wise Elder
nodes.text: This is the Traveler's Rest, a sanctuary at the heart of the world. From here, you may journey in any direction. To the forests, deserts, mountains, and beyond. Structures and dungeons dot the landscape - each holds treasures and dangers.

nodes.speaker: Wise Elder
nodes.text: The world is filled with monsters - goblins, wolves, skeletons, and far worse. Dungeons are especially dangerous but hold the greatest rewards. Be wary of dragons in their lairs. Press [M] to view your world map and plan your journey.

nodes.speaker: Wise Elder
nodes.text: Trust your instincts. Run from battles you cannot win - there is no shame in retreat. Visit villages to trade and rest. And remember: death is not the end, merely a lesson. Now go forth, brave traveler!
